Others: Kevon Looney provided valuable minutes off the bench for the Golden State Warriors in their 107-104 win over the Detroit Pistons.
Looney scored 8 points on 4-6 shooting from the field, grabbed 8 rebounds, and dished out 3 assists in just over 20 minutes of action.
Looney's playmaking was on display, as he found slashers such as Lindy Waters III for scores in the half-court.
Looney helped Golden State contain Pistons center Jalen Duren, who finished with 8 points, 12 rebounds, and 3 blocks.
This was only Looney's fifth start of the season across 31 games played.
Coach Steve Kerr praised Looney, stating, 'Heâ€™s a winner.'
